Legal_Issue: Did the applicant meet the residency requirement under paragraph 5(1)c) of the Citizenship Act?
Application_Facts: The applicant claimed 1,138 days of presence but lacked convincing evidence (no passport, inactive bank account, no taxable income).
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of citizenship judge's decision
Court_Ruling: Appeal dismissed; applicant did not meet residency requirements
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to prove 1,095 days of physical residency in Canada within four years prior to application
Assessment_Factor: Residency compliance based on documentary evidence
Credibility_Assessment: Insufficient proof of residency; lack of credible documentation
Evidence_Used: Passport records (absent), bank account activity (inactive), tax filings (no taxable income)
Governing_Rule: Applicant must reside in Canada for at least 1,095 days in the four years preceding the citizenship application
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of passport, inactive bank account, no taxable income records
Cause_Description: Rejection of citizenship application due to insufficient residency evidence
Evidence_Handling: Judge found evidence unconvincing and insufficient to establish residency
Evidence_Issues: Absence of reliable documents to prove physical presence
Residency_Compliance: Not met; 1,095-day requirement not sufficiently proven
Evidence_Assessment: Evidence was assessed as insufficient and unconvincing
Decision_Rationale: Applicant failed to provide convincing evidence to meet the legal residency requirement
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of passport, financial, or tax records to substantiate residency
